qas.question: Despite being much smaller than wester europe, what they known for being?
What could you find in Novgorod that you couldn't in most other cities?
What were some of the rights women had during this time period?
What area was sparsely populated compared to Northern Europe?
Despite being larger than Western Europe, what was Kievan Rus known for being?
What couldn't you find in Novgoroad that was available in most other cities?
Who did not confine punishment to fines and used capital punishment?
What rights were denied to women?

context: <b3_0>Kievan Rus<b3_0/>', although sparsely populated compared to Western Europe, was not only <a0_0>the <b4_0>largest contemporary European state<b4_0/><a0_0/> in terms of area but also culturally advanced. Literacy in Kiev, Novgorod and other large cities was high. As birch bark documents attest, they exchanged love letters and prepared cheat sheets for schools. Novgorod had a <a1_0><b5_0>sewage system and wood paving<b5_0/><a1_0/> not often found in other cities at the time. The <b6_0>Russkaya Pravda<b6_0/> confined punishments to fines and generally did not use capital punishment. Certain rights were accorded to women, such as <a2_0><b7_0>property and inheritance rights<b7_0/><a2_0/>.
